ingredients: 1 pound chicken, cut into bite-sized pieces
Spaghetti (small amount for an alternative side, optional)
instructions: Season the chicken pieces generously with salt and pepper.
In a large skillet or pot, melt the shortening over medium heat.
Add the chicken to the skillet and cook until browned on all sides and cooked through (about 8-10 minutes). Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
Add the chopped tomatoes and ground coriander to the skillet and cook for 3-5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the tomatoes soften slightly.
Stir in the rice and cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly, until the rice is lightly toasted.
Add 2 cups of water to the skillet (or more, according to rice package instructions). Season with salt to taste.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low, cover the skillet, and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the rice is cooked and the liquid is absorbed.
Stir in the cooked chicken and golden raisins.
Heat up the refried beans in a separate pan or microwave, following package instructions.
Serve the chicken and rice mixture. Optionally, serve with a small portion of spaghetti. Garnish with chopped banana, if desired.
Serve a portion of refried beans on the side.
response.name: Spiced Chicken and Rice with a Sweet Raisin Twist (Dairy-Free)
